intro: Peckia, commonly known as the yellow dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many daisies and sunflowers. The plant features a basal rosette of heart-shaped, rough-textured leaves. Its most distinctive characteristic is its bright yellow flower head, which consists of numerous tiny florets. Peckia is often found in open fields, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils.
